prop.head.label.name: Part
prop.head.headtext: Handling Cases Before the Judicial Panel on Multidistrict Litigation

prop.head.label.name: Chapter
prop.head.headtext: Factors in Deciding Whether Transfer Is Appropriate

head.headtext: Arguments rejected by the Panel—Effect transfer would have on settlement

para.paratext: The Panel may consider the effect transfer for coordinated or consolidated pretrial proceedings may have on the overall likelihood of settlement of cases. It generally considers this question in the abstract, and most often does not directly address it in its decisions.

The Panel will not consider arguments from individual litigants on the effect transfer would have on the settlement posture of their cases.[1] In one case the Panel rejected an argument of a defendant that transfer would increase the “nuisance” settlement cost of a case.[2]

The pendency of a proposed settlement may cause the Panel to deny transfer, especially where it concludes that centralization would likely interfere with that settlement.[3] Speculation about the possible impact on a settlement that has not yet been reached is not likely to support the same result.[4]
Maslon Edelman Borman & Brand, LLP, Minneapolis, Minnesota.

In re Edward H. Okun I.R.S. § 1031 Tax Deferred Exchange Litigation, 609 F. Supp. 2d 1380 (J.P.M.L. 2009) (Panel notes that denying transfer would result in delay); In re Banc of America Inv. Services, Inc., 466 F. Supp. 2d 1353 (J.P.M.L. 2006). See also In re Virgin Mobile Initial Public Offering (IPO) Securities Litigation, 542 F. Supp. 2d 1372 (J.P.M.L. 2008); In re Texas Roadhouse Fair and Accurate Credit Transactions Act (FACTA) Litigation, 542 F. Supp. 2d 1370 (J.P.M.L. 2008).

See In re H & R Block, Inc., Express IRA Marketing Litigation, 444 F. Supp. 2d 1339 (J.P.M.L. 2006); In re SFBC International, Inc., Securities & Derivative Litigation, 435 F. Supp. 2d 1355 (J.P.M.L. 2006); In re Grain Shipments, 327 F. Supp. 1313, 1314 (J.P.M.L. 1971).

See In re Pilot Flying J Fuel Rebate Contract Litigation, 2013 WL 4041557 (J.P.M.L. 2013) (centralization would delay nationwide settlement already receiving preliminary approval); In re JPMorgan Chase Bank, N.A., Mortg. Corp. Force-Placed Hazard Ins. Litigation, 2013 WL 4048390 (J.P.M.L. 2013) (settlement reached following filing of 1407 transfer motion).
